short_description: This function is used to find the result of overlaying two geometries.
long_description: The GeometryOverlay function takes two geometries described by the well-known text (WKT) markup language and outputs the result of overlaying them, as specified by the boundary operator. You can use this function to prepare sets of geometries for input to the PointInPolygon function. For example, you can use this function to prepare a geometry that contains all cellular phone reception polygons near an airport to create a geometry that is useful for identifying frequent fliers.

input_tables.name: source
input_tables.rDescription: The input table contains the source geometry information
input_tables.description: The input table contains the source geometry information

input_tables.name: reference
input_tables.rDescription: The input table contains the reference geometry information
input_tables.description: The input table contains the reference geometry information

argument_clauses.name: SourceLocationColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the source table column that contains the polygon description in WKT format.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the source table column that contains the polygon description in WKT format.

argument_clauses.name: ReferenceLocationColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the reference table column that contains the location of the polygon description in WKT format.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the reference table column that contains the location of the polygon description in WKT format.

argument_clauses.name: ReferenceNameColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the reference table column that contains the names of the polygons.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of the reference table columns that contain the names of the polygons.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the source table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the source table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: BoundaryOperator
argument_clauses.description: Specify a boundary (geometry overlay) operator from the following table. Boundary Operator Result Description UNION Result contains area covered by source polygon and area covered by reference polygon (blue area in figure). INTERSECTION Result contains area that is common to source and reference polygons (blue area in figure). DIFFERENCE Result contains area covered only by source polygon (blue area in figure). SYMDIFFERENCE Result contains area covered by only source polygon or only reference polygon (blue area in figure). CONVEXHULL Result contains smallest convex set that contains source polygon in Euclidean plane (blue area in figure). BUFFER Result contains source polygon and specified buffer. A positive buffer extends area of polygon. In upper figure, result includes both buffer (blue) and source polygon (pale pink). A negative buffer decreases area of polygon. In lower figure, result includes only source polygon (blue). Note: For buffer operation, eight segments is adopted in curve approximation for corners.

argument_clauses.name: OutputAll
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to include the result of non-intersection geometries in the output. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether to include the result of nonintersection geometries in the output table. Default: 'false'

argument_clauses.name: Distance
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the distance by which to extend or decrease the polygon.
argument_clauses.description: [Required with BoundaryOperator('BUFFER').] Specify the distance by which to extend or decrease the polygon.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
